name: Pearl Studs
description:
Pearl Studs Etched or textured sterling silver and fresh water pearls with 14k white gold ear posts They are a scant 3/4” at their widest sides. Price: $78 each pair I never put my pearl studs up on the internet so this is a rare opportunity to buy a pair online. A & B are my etched sterling with the string design and the smooshed donuts. The square C. pair have a dappled hammered finish and are brighter & shinier then the photo shows. The triangles have keshi pearls. Keshi pearls, also called cornflake pearls sometimes, are unusual and hard to get. Keshi pearls are natural free shaped flat. Its always hard to find a matching shape.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Low Dome Earrings
description:
Low Dome Earrings Textured sterling with sterling tubes and ear wires. Length from bend in ear wire: 2 5/8”; domes apx 7/8” round; 3/8” deep Price: $85 There were several things going on when I designed these. First I wanted to see if I could get dimension and a sense of volume in a non-soldered earring. Also I wanted an inexpensive earring that still had lots of style and was unique. And finally I love the long ear wires. Some question the length but I find its great for women with longer hair as it brings the earrings down and out of the hair so they show more. For us short haired women it gives us a chance to have that flippy movement at our ears as we “flip” our hair back. As always I have patinaed them to give them a richness and to show the texture I put on the sterling. All in all these earrings were very successful in reaching my goals and I really love them. Now I just need to find the spot this good idea came to me so I can design another pair as successful.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Beam Me Up Scotty Earrings
description:
Beam Me Up Scotty Earrings Sterling Silver, Copper & Mokume-gane (A Japanese alloy of layers of sterling and copper) From bend in ear wire –length is 1 5/8”; bottom dish is 1 ¼” x 1” Price: $195 These earrings are incredibly light-weight & kinetic! They move around the sterling earring wire as you move. The small dish is sterling, the middle Mokume-gane, and the bottom sterling and copper. All have been run through my rolling mill to give them their shape and lightness. Finally they were patinaed to give them the yummy chocolate color. This are some of my favorite earrings as they move with you.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Long Etched Earrings w/ pearls
description:
Long Etched Earrings w/ Pearls Etched Sterling Silver, fresh water pearls Length with Pearls: 2 1/4”: 1/4” wide; 3/16” deep Price: $210 These earrings are made with some of my etched sterling silver. It has been patinaed to give the metal a rich feel of depth and layers. I love the lines echoing the shape of the earrings while the pearls give a bright counter point to all. These earrings are hollow formed, so are lighter weight then they appear. The ear posts are 14k white gold…..always.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Pumpkin Earrings
description:
Pumpkin Earrings Sterling silver –hollow forms Length from bend in earwire: 2”; apx 7/8” round; 3/16” deep Price: $210 Guess what time of year I made these? There is something so compelling about a circle. Yet I can’t help but “deconstruct” it a bit just to mess with its symmetry. If I could get drill bits that drilled square holes or better ovals I’d be in heaven. These earrings are one of my many variations on the hollow form. It’s my version of a musical riff. I love playing with proportions, different styles of hanging, length of ear wires. These were the first time I used the long loop. You will see more of it. The sterling has been heavily textured and patinaed to bring out the richness in the metal.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Ebony & Holly Dangles
description:
Ebony & Holly Dangles Laminated Holly & Ebony, etched sterling silver, 14k white gold posts Length: 2 5/8”; Width at widest point: 3/4”; depth 3/16” on sterling box Price: $295 This is a pair of earrings from my newest collection. I am starting to work with wood-ebony and holly. I love the black of the ebony set against the ivory colored holly. This is a striking pair of earrings. I call them power earrings. The woman who wears this is a person to be reckoned with. She will not be easily ignored. The sterling box is hollow formed, etched with my smooshed donuts pattern. The box has been texture with file marks on the sides and is patinaed to bring out he richness of the metal.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Partial C Pendant
description:
Partial C Pendant with Pearls Etched Sterling Silver, fresh water pearls Stainless steel cable, hand-fabricated necklace findings Pendant is: 1 3/8” across, 5/8” wide, 3/8” deep Cable + clasp length is 17” It can be shortened or lengthened. Price: $270 This is one of my favorite hollow forms done in my smooshed donuts etched pattern. It started as a round disc that formed into a bowl - then decked on the open side; finally the bowl was “deconstructed” into this elegant pendant. The fresh water pearls accent its graceful shape. It has been patinaed to give it a richness and high light the etching. Needs a better name though. Have any ideas? This necklace will go from the little black dress to a favorite pair of jeans. The clasp is designed to be decorative & easy to manipulate. It won’t release accidently or snag on clothes.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Holly ConeFlower Necklace with Pearls
description:
Holly ConeFlower Necklace Holly wood, Sterling, & Fresh Water Pearls Black nylon stainless steel cable, hand-fabricated necklace findings “Flower” is 3 3/4” long, 1 1/4” wide, 3/8” deep, Necklace length is: 18 1/2” It can be shortened or lengthened Price: $305 One of my favorite flowers is the coneflower (Echinacea). It was in my mind when I carved this necklace out of holly. Holly is the most white, tight-grained wood grown in North America. And I use it for that reason. The sterling silver piece was designed to blend in with the holly without detracting from it. The iridescent pearls are the perfect compliment to the white of the holly. The “flower” is lightly stained to add extra depth and as always, you will see purposeful file marks, left to show the hand of the maker. This necklace will go from the little black dress to a favorite pair of jeans. The clasp is designed to be decorative & easy to manipulate. It won’t release accidently or snag on clothes.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.

name: Striped Wood Ring with Padparadscha Sapphire
description:
Striped Wood Ring with Padparadscha Sapphire Ebonized hard word, maple, man-made Pad Sapphire, and sterling Across widest part of top: 1”; 5/16” thick Size: 7 Price: $250 Part of my new work with woods this ring with its red-orange Padparadsha sapphire is an attention grabber. I love working with the wood as I can get new shapes and I am intrigued how the stripes reveal themselves as I sculpt the shape. The sterling setting is textured with file marks and has been patinaed to give the metal a rich feel. This ring cannot be resized.

**To see images LARGER click on + in upper left corner.
